newsitem.title: USA: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Friede makes a splash.
newsitem.headline: IPO HIGHLIGHTS - Friede makes a splash.

text.p: Friede Goldman International Inc exploded onto the stock market scene on Tuesday, trading at 23-1/4, or 33.6 percent above its $17 pricing on its first day of trade.

Friede Goldman, which provides conversion and retrofit services for offshore drilling rigs, was originally expected to price at between $14.00 and $16.00. However, underwriter Jefferies & Co punched up the asking price to $17.00 before the company went public.
In a further show of confidence, Jefferies also hiked the number of shares available from 3.8 million to 4.7 million.

Friede Goldman has a 32-acre shipyard in Pascagoula, Miss., near the Gulf of Mexico, where it can work on six offshore drilling rigs simultaneiously. The company began construction on a new 85-acre shipyard in the same area in the second quarter of 1997.
Friede Goldman has also entered into a new market recently, that of converting offshore drilling units into deepwater floating production and offloading vessels.

Also entering its first day of trade on Tuesday was RIT Technologies Ltd. RIT filed for an initial public offering of up to 2.25 million ordinary shares, which it expected to sell at between $7.50 and $9.50 per share.

The computer network wiring products company, based in Tel Aviv, traded at a placid 8-1/16 in the early afternoon after pricing at eight. Underwriters Untenberg Harris and Pennsylvania Merchant Group Ltd offered 2.3 million share for trade, up a smidgen from 2.25 million shares indicated in the original filing.
